briefdescription.para: Unpacks a 16 bit unsigned integer from a data pointer.
Packs a 32 bit unsigned integer into a data pointer.
Unpacks a 32 bit unsigned integer from a data pointer.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int pos, int type, const void *value, int byte_order, int *old_end_pos, int *new_end_pos)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_set_basic

briefdescription.para: Sets an existing basic type value to a new value.

detaileddescription.para: Arguments work the same way as _dbus_marshal_basic_type().

parameterdescription.para: the type of the current and new values
the address of the new value
location to store end position of the old value, or NULL
location to store end position of the new value, or NULL

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int insert_at, int type, const void *value, int byte_order, int *pos_after)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_write_basic

detaileddescription.para: The "value" pointer is always the address of a variable containing the basic type value. So for example for int32 it will be dbus_int32_t*, and for string it will be const char**. This is for symmetry with _dbus_marshal_read_basic() and to have a simple consistent rule.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to a variable containing the value
NULL or the position after the type

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int insert_at, int element_type, const void *value, int n_elements, int byte_order, int *pos_after)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_write_fixed_multi

briefdescription.para: Marshals a block of values of fixed-length type all at once, as an optimization.

detaileddescription.para: dbus_type_is_fixed() returns TRUE for fixed-length types, which are the basic types minus the string-like types.
The value argument should be the adddress of an array, so e.g. "const dbus_uint32_t**"

parameterdescription.para: address of an array to marshal
number of elements in the array
NULL or the position after the type

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int pos, int type, void *value, int byte_order, int *new_pos)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_read_basic

detaileddescription.para: The "value" pointer is always the address of a variable of the basic type. So e.g. if the basic type is "double" then the pointer is a double*, and if it's "char*" then the pointer is a "char**".

A value of type DBusBasicValue is guaranteed to be large enough to hold any of the types that may be returned, which is handy if you are trying to do things generically. For example you can pass a DBusBasicValue* in to this function, and then pass the same DBusBasicValue* in to _dbus_marshal_basic_type() in order to move a value from one place to another.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to update with new position, or NULL

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int pos, int element_type, void *value, int n_elements, int byte_order, int *new_pos)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_read_fixed_multi

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int type, int byte_order, int *pos)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_skip_basic

briefdescription.para: Skips over a basic-typed value, reporting the following position.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to position in the string, updated on return to new position

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int element_type, int byte_order, int *pos)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_skip_array

briefdescription.para: Skips an array, returning the next position.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to position in the string, updated on return to new position

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int pos, dbus_uint32_t value, int byte_order)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_set_uint32

briefdescription.para: Sets the 4 bytes at the given offset to a marshaled unsigned integer, replacing anything found there previously.

parameterdescription.para: the string to write the marshalled int to
the byte offset where int should be written

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int pos, int byte_order, int *new_pos)
memberdef.name: _dbus_marshal_read_uint32

briefdescription.para: Convenience function to demarshal a 32 bit unsigned integer.

parameterdescription.para: the new position of the string

briefdescription.para: Return TRUE if the typecode is a valid typecode.

detaileddescription.para: DBUS_TYPE_INVALID surprisingly enough is not considered valid, and random unknown bytes aren't either. This function is safe with untrusted data.

briefdescription.para: Gets the alignment requirement for the given type; will be 1, 4, or 8.
Returns a string describing the given type.

simplesect.para: a constant string describing the type

briefdescription.para: Get the first type in the signature.

detaileddescription.para: The difference between this and just getting the first byte of the signature is that you won't get DBUS_STRUCT_BEGIN_CHAR, you'll get DBUS_TYPE_STRUCT instead.

simplesect.para: the first type in the signature

briefdescription.para: Similar to _dbus_first_type_in_signature, but operates on a C string buffer.

simplesect.para: the first type in the signature

briefdescription.para: Swaps the elements of an array to the opposite byte order.
